input_text:
Job Title: Security Officer

Location: Ankeny, IA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Management, Other

Description:
Casey's is searching for a full-time Security Officer to join our team in Ankeny, IA! As a Security Officer, you will guard, patrol, and monitor premises to ensure safety and security. You'll also respond to emergencies, suspicious activity, and disturbances as needed and assist supervisory staff and local authorities as necessary. Responsible for de-escalation and intervention as needed in order to preserve order and protect property.

Additional Responsibilities

Monitors and authorizes entrance and departure of vehicles, team members, visitors at all entrances including the truck lot. Ensures proper authorization prior to entering or departing building or gate area.Keeps supervisor apprised of daily activities and/or irregularities; writes incident reports, maintain records and logs regarding the same.Responds to alarms, responds to phone calls, and calls police or fire departments in cases of emergency, such as fire or presence of unauthorized persons, and/or assists in responding to.Applies logic and reasoning to detect signs of intrusion, theft, or concerning events. This may include but is not limited to, inspection of visitor and security code access logs, patrolling premises to inspect doors, windows, and gates, passing through all areas of the complex, testing locked or otherwise secure facilities, etc.Monitors fire alarms, safety equipment, video and electronic surveillance and security systems.Enforces all Casey's Policies, warning persons of rule infractions or violations and direct eviction violators from premises. Prevents passage of prohibited individuals and/or articles and escorts individuals off the property as necessary.

Hours for this position will be four 10-hour days with weekend and holiday rotations. Ability to work overnight as needed is required.

What you can expect when you join the Casey's Team:

A transformative culture putting service first and taking pride in caring for our guests, our communities, and each other.Opportunities to use cutting edge technologies and enterprise wide collaboration to enable our strategy and drive world class service.The right balance between work and life, to do your best work and enjoy those important personal moments. Ask about our options for workplace flexibility that may be available.We're here for families! Great benefits including choices in medical plans, dental, vision, life insurance, employee stock purchase program, charitable giving programs, parental leave AND an onsite Child Development Center.Competitive pay, 401k company match up to 6%, vacation & sick time, paid holidays, volunteer time, and an onsite cafeteria.Dress for your day dress code, jeans are welcomed!The opportunity to work for a big company that has not lost our small company feel. Our senior leadership team is engaged, involved, and accessible!

What are you waiting for? Come be a part of a company that is growing, transforming, and is here for good!

Requirements

High school education or equivalent.Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and active listening communication skills.Strong problem-solving skills. Must possess and maintain a valid driver's license and have the physical ability to drive a vehicle for job-related travel.Able to stand, sit, kneel multiple times throughout work shift.Able to lift a minimum of 50 lbs easily/multiple times during work shift.Ability to work overnight as needed.

Preferred

Previous security, law enforcement, or related work experience.Knowledge of public safety and security strategies to promote effective, secure operations.Knowledge of security policies, procedures, and regulations.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
